title: 113_s1415
content: The Act is titled the "Canyon Mountain Land Conveyance Act of 2013" and includes definitions. The Act defines "Federal land" as approximately 17,826 acres depicted on a specific map and "planning area" as land administered by the Bureau of Land Management in various districts. It also clarifies the term "public domain land" according to the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The Lakeview District defines "public domain land" as per the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976. The term excludes land managed under the Act of August 28, 1937. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and the Tribe refers to the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE. The United States conveys Federal land to the Tribe, including improvements, appurtenances, and minerals. A survey will establish boundary lines. SEC. 4. MAP AND LEGAL DESCRIPTION. SEC. 4. MAP AND LEGAL DESCRIPTION. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of Federal land with relevant committees. The filed map and legal description will have the same force as if included in the Act and will be available for public inspection. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. This Act does not affect existing Tribe rights to land. Prohibitions include restrictions on exporting unprocessed logs and prohibiting gaming activities on trust land. SEC. 6. FOREST MANAGEMENT. Commercial forestry on Federal land must comply with Federal laws. SEC. 7. LAND RECLASSIFICATION. The Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary must identify Oregon and California Railroad land within 180 days. Public domain land of similar acreage and condition must be identified within 18 months. Maps depicting the identified land must be submitted to Congress within 2 years. The identified public domain land will be reclassified as land owned by the railroad after public comment. After public comment, the Secretary will reclassify the identified public domain land as land owned by the Oregon and California Railroad. The Act of August 28, 1937 will apply to the reclassified land.
